title: Silence 4
text:
Silence 4 were a <a href="Portugal">Portuguese</a> band, formed in 1996, who mostly sung in <a href="English%20language">English</a>. They released two albums to high critical acclaim, "<a href="Silence%20Becomes%20It">Silence Becomes It</a>" (1998) and "<a href="Only%20Pain%20Is%20Real">Only Pain Is Real</a>" (2000). The band never officially disbanded, but went on an undetermined hiatus from 2001 to 2013, when their members decided to reunite for a brief tour after <a href="Sofia%20Lisboa">Sofia Lisboa</a> underwent cancer treatment. Lead singer <a href="David%20Fonseca">David Fonseca</a> is currently undertaking a solo career.
History.
Formation.
The band's genesis took place in 1995. After good feedback from showing some <a href="demo%20tape">demo tape</a>s to a music shop owner in <a href="Leiria">Leiria</a>, <a href="David%20Fonseca">David Fonseca</a> approached <a href="Sofia%20Lisboa">Sofia Lisboa</a> with the idea of forming a band. That idea only materialized one year later, when both of them invited <a href="Rui%20Costa%20%28Silence%204%29">Rui Costa</a> to the band — who suggested they turn off the <a href="instrument%20amplifier">amplifiers</a> and play acoustic, in "silence".
They won a 500.000 <a href="Portuguese%20escudo">escudos</a> (roughly 2500 <a href="euro">euro</a>s) prize in a band festival, which was spent totally in making demos. When presenting these to <a href="record%20label">labels</a>, the answer was always the same: "Singing in English? No way!" Refusing to balk at the demand of recording totally in <a href="Portuguese%20language">Portuguese</a>, they ended up recording a <a href="cover%20version">cover</a> of <a href="Erasure">Erasure</a>'s "<a href="A%20Little%20Respect">A Little Respect</a>", which was included in the compilation <a href="Sons%20de%20Todas%20as%20Cores">Sons de Todas as Cores</a> (released in 1998), giving it massive airplay and good critical response.
"Silence Becomes It".
<a href="Polygram">Polygram</a> (now <a href="Universal%20Music%20Group">Universal</a>) finally accepted to work with them, but with some restrictions: minimum budget (5 million escudos — 25 thousand euros), and they would only receive <a href="royalties">royalties</a> after selling 10 thousand records. The resulting album was "<a href="Silence%20Becomes%20It">Silence Becomes It</a>", which was certified "<a href="Music%20recording%20sales%20certification%23List%20of%20international%20sales%20certification%20thresholds">platinum</a>" 5 times (over 200 thousand records sold), spending months on top of the Portuguese <a href="Record%20chart">charts</a>. A national tour ensued, with 90 concerts in 6 months. On December 18, the legendary <a href="Pavilh%C3%A3o%20Atl%C3%A2ntico">Pavilhão Atlântico</a> concert took place.
"Only Pain Is Real".
They kept touring in 1999, though with less concerts. Then came a period of absence, when they "escaped" to London. It was there, at the <a href="Ridge%20Farm%20Studio">Ridge Farm Studio</a>, that their second album, "<a href="Only%20Pain%20Is%20Real">Only Pain Is Real</a>", was born. The album was presented in Leiria, in 2000, and took 2 weeks to reach platinum certification. Then came another tour, with over 100 concerts in one year, ending with two unique concerts at the <a href="Coliseu%20dos%20Recreios">Coliseu dos Recreios</a> in <a href="Lisboa">Lisboa</a>, on December 19 and 20.
